lines.text: All right, you want it in the chest, or the head?
Yeah, that's what your wife said.
Hey, would you stop with the wife shit?
Ask me how fat she is.
Fuck you, man! How fat is she?

She's so fat I had to roll her in flour and look for the wet spot. Motherfucker, if you wanna fuck her you gotta slap her thigh and ride the wave in. Now I'm not saying she's fat, her high school picture was an aerial photograph.
[Joe has just found out that Mike was sleeping with his wife]
It just happened, Joe. It...

Sure, sure, I know... it just happened. Coulda happened to anybody. It was an accident, right? You tripped, slipped on the floor and accidentally stuck your dick in my wife. "Whoops! I'm so sorry, Mrs. H. I guess this just isn't my week."
The sky is blue, water is wet, women have secrets. Who gives a fuck?
[Jimmy is being approached by a bunch of goons]
Right now, I'm trying to figure out which one of you looks the most like my dick. If you got something to say, say it. Otherwise get the fuck outta here.
[Joe Hallenbeck wakes up in his car and stares at his grubby reflection in the mirror]
Nobody likes you. Everybody hates you. You're gonna lose. Smile, you fuck.
You think you're so fuckin' cool, don't you? You think you're so fuckin' cool. Well just once, I would like to hear you scream, in pain.
Play some rap music.
Drop the gun, Hallenbeck.
[takes Joe's gun and tosses it]
Bit late for a stroll, don't you think?
Yeah, you girls oughta be gettin' home.
Yeah, streetlights are on.
Shut up, fuckface.
I'm fuckface, he's asshole.
[Jimmy smiles sarcastically, in agreement]
Jake?
[Jake punches Joe in the face]
Apprise Rodney Dangerfield here of his situation. Perhaps we can dispense with the fun and games now, yes?
You want the envelope, right?
The envelope, very smart. See, Jake, here's a man who knows when a situation is untenable.
Good word.
You like that word? And you do have that envelope, don't you?
Better give up, Jimmy. We're dealin' with a couple of geniuses here.
[Jake punches Joe in the face again]
Alright man, just leave him the fuck alone!
[Jake kicks Jimmy in the groin]
Leave him alone? Sure, whatever you say. Jake attacks his job with a certain exuberance.
Shit, we're bein' beat up by the inventor of Scrabble.
He's still in a good mood, Jake. Kick him again.
All right! You want the envelope the hooker had, right?
She wasn't a hooker, Joe.
Shut the fuck up.
Wrong place, wrong time. Nothing personal.
That's what you think. Last night I fucked your wife.
Oh you did, hah? How'd you know it was my wife?
She said her husband was a big pimp lookin' motherfucker with a hat.
Oh, you're real cool for somebody who's about to take a bullet.
After fucking your wife I'll take two.
You don't like women much do ya Joe.

[about his wife]
At least I liked the guy she was fuckin'. He was my best friend.
Nah man, he was a scumbag private detective.
All private detectives are scumbags.
Yeah, but that scumbag tried to get you killed.
Yeah well, friends can't be perfect. I wish that water wasn't wet, I wish the sky wasn't blue and I wish that I didn't still love my wife. Ahh, life sucks!
[reaches for a glass of wine]
Man, you couldn't protect a cup of warm piss.
[throws ice at Joe]
Why don't you just go ahead and hit me?
Excuse me?
Come on, chicken shit. Bust me in the chops. You don't think an old guy like me could hurt ya, do ya Jimmy?
So now you know my name?
James Alexander Dix. Quarterback for the L.A. Stallions, '89-'90. Banned from the league on gambling charges, allegations of drug abuse. Another tragic tale of wasted youth.

[stands up from his chair]
Now you're starting to piss me off.
It's about fuckin' time. I'm Joe Hallenbeck.

[Joe reaches out his hand, Jimmy slaps it]
I'm a private detective.
You're like a fuckin' lowlife to me.
At least I didn't shit my talent away on coke.
[Jimmy tries to punch Joe, who subsequently blocks his punch and pushes him on the ground]

[noticing his spilled whiskey]
I spilled my warm cup of piss.
This is the '90s. You can't just walk up and slap a guy, you have to say something cool first.
I figure you gotta be the dumbest guy in the world, Joe. You're trying the save the life of the man who ruined your career, and avenge the death of the guy that fucked your wife.

[Joe just found out that Mathews was having an affair with his wife]
Head or gut, Mike?
Joe, how long have we been friends?
I'd say roughly until you started banging my wife. Head or gut?

[sighs]
Gut.

[punches Mike in the gut]
Got that address for me?

[out of breath]
Huh?
The surveillance job.

[still out of breath]
You still want the job?
500 bucks is 500 bucks, Mike.

[gives Joe a picture of Cory]
Yeah, I guess you're right.

[looking at the picture]
Cory, huh? You throw a shot into her too?
[Mike leaves]

[to his neighbor's dog who keeps coming into his yard]
Get the fuck out of here, go shit in your own yard.
Can we do a formal introduction here?
Who gives a fuck? You're the bad guy, right?
I am the bad guy.
And I'm supposed to be trembling with fear, something like that?
Something like that.
Fine. I'll start trembling in a minute.
What, you don't believe in love?
Yeah, I believe in love; I also believe in cancer.
What, they're both diseases?
Yeah, something like that.

[Joe doesn't like the music being played at the strip club where Cory works]
This the only kind of music they play in this joint?
Mm-hm.
I hate this funk shit. I'll have to charge you extra.
What did you expect?
The Four Freshmen. Pat Boone.
What are you, my father?
Yeah, I'm your father. Go put some clothes on.
You're hilarious.
[Gets up to leave]
Go stick your head in that speaker. You'll be screaming, "Play that funky music, white boy!"
The screaming part, I believe.
If you go any faster we're gonna travel back in time.
[to Milo]
I told you, if you ever touch me again, I'll kill you.
Can I have a cigarette?
A cigarette? Yeah sure.
[gives him one]
Got a light?
Yeah, got a light.
[pretends to give him a light and punches him instead]
Hey baby I thought you were tough. See Pablo, he's no sweat!
I seem to have dropped my cigarette. May I have another?

[hesitates]
Sure, sure thing buddy.
[gives him another cigarette]
I'm gonna need a light. You touch me again, I'll kill ya.
I'm saying again for the cheap seats, Lieutenant. I DON'T KNOW WHERE JOE HALLENBECK IS! That's my fucking statement! Write it down and shove it up your ass.
I could nail you for obstruction.
You couldn't nail a two dollar whore.

[arguing; justifying her infidelity]
You were never around. You know what? Fuck you, Joe. I was lonely!
Buy a dog.
Leather pants.
Yeah.
What's something like that run?
Six-fifty.
Six hundred and fifty dollars?
Yeah.
They're pants.
Yeah.
You wear them?
YES.
They don't, like, have a TV in them or something?
Nope.
I am very old.
[Joe is talking to a puppet on his hand]

[speaking as puppet]
Why did Mr. Milo cross the road?
I don't know. Why?

[speaking as puppet]
Because his dick was stuck in a chicken!
Where are you goin'?
To the bathroom, okay. You wanna come? The doc said I shouldn't lift anything heavy.
No, I'll pass.
Hey, man. You ever play ball? You've got a good build.
What are you, a fag?
No, I'm just trying to break the ice.
I like ice. Leave it the fuck alone.
Oh, you're a lot of fun to be with.
[On pulling up to Joe Hallenbeck's home]
Wow, an actual house. I was thinking a cave with... skulls and shit.
[Joe gets to his office, after waking up next to a dead squirrel a bunch of kids threw in his car]
What'd you do last night?
I think I fucked a squirrel to death, and don't remember.
Oh, if it isn't Shelly Marcone himself.
Careful, son. Just my friends call me Shelly.
You got friends? When did this happen?
I want to meet the bitch that fucked *you* up.

Alex was my son, I used to be married, one Sunday away in Miami my wife couldn't come because she was eight months pregnant, she walking down La Brea boulevard, out of nowhere a pickup truck jumped the curb POW! she never knew what hit her she died, but Alex lived in a incubator for seventeen minutes, just enough time for one dream, then he died, I think about him all the time, I threw for three hundred yards that day while my wife and kid were dying, I played the game of my life, life sucks.
[Joe and Jimmy are trying to tell the bodyguards in a car about a bomb]
Now what are you doing?
I'm drawing them a picture.
What is that?
It's a bomb.
It doesn't look like a bomb, it looks like an apple with lines comin' out of it. They're gonna say "Don't open the briefcase, it's full of fresh fruit!"
You wanna draw the damn thing?
[Jimmy shows Joe the drawing of a bomb with "BOM" written below]
Happy?
Are you kidding me?

[shows the drawing to the bodyguards]
Always criticizing my shit. I can't do nothin' right.
[the bodyguards shoot at them]
Oh, shit!
I forgot to tell you. "Bom" means "fuck you" in Polish.
Hey, that's not funny, man. I almost bought it there!
Tragic loss to the art world, let me tell ya.
I swear to Christ, Junior, if I survive this fuckin' case I'm gonna dance a jig.
What?
I'm gonna dance a jig, I swear to Christ.
The sky is blue, water is wet, women have secrets.
Feel like I've been rode hard and put away wet.
What the hell does that mean?
It's horse talk, man.
They got the brothers ridin' horses now, huh?
Yeah, cars're gettin' too hard to steal.
You ever wear, like, a little cowboy hat?

[laughs]
I'm really good, man. Maybe I could take your daughter out. What's she like?
She's like thirteen years old, and if you even look at her funny, I'm gonna stick an umbrella up your ass and open it.
You're a real bastard, ya know that, Joe?
And then some.
So... you don't think the cops can help you?
Sure. After I'm dead, they'll perform the autopsy.
The hell's that number on the back of your head? Is that like a license plate in case somebody tries to steal it?
No. It's a football thing. It's my high school number.
So when do you graduate?
...You wanna be left alone, don't you? I'll be in the kitchen, over here.

[giving Jimmy a briefcase full of $6 million]
Go buy yourself a new pair of pants.

[to himself]
Okay, what would Joe do at a time like this? He'd kill everybody and smoke some cigarettes.
Ain't life a bitch?
[shoots himself in the head]
Hi, you're nobody.
Shhh, don't tell anyone.
Good morning, gentlemen. Is there a problem?
Yes, officer. As a matter of fact there is a problem. Apparently there are too many bullets in this gun.
[uses the gun to kill the officer]

[about Cory]
She's hot, Joe. She rates a three on my finger scale. That means I'd cut off three of my fingers if God would let me fuck her.
It ain't right.
No, it ain't right.
[sighs]
This ain't no game, flash. Real guns, real bullets. It's dangerous.
Danger's my middle name.
Mine's Cornelius. You tell anybody, I'll kill you.
You ever watch "Soul Train"?
Shut the fuck up.
There's a new invention out. It's called the razor.
Too risky, I might start thinkin' about you and slash my wrists.
She gets evidence to use against 'em, right?
That's right.
So now we have the evidence.
What we got, Junior, is Marcone and Baynard by the nuts and that is why I love America.
Hey flash, rescue attempt?
Blow me.
You must be James.

[sarcastically]
James?
He does that with everybody. He calls me Joseph.
I trust you're alone.
No, I got the fuckin' Vienna Boys Choir with me. What, is everybody stupid around here?
[thug slams his head into car bonnet]
Just you, kid.
Hey, you got a car here? Hey! You got a car?
Yeah.
Give me the keys.
No way.

[Holds his gun to Darian's head]
Give me the keys or I shoot the kid.

[Jimmy has just survived being thrown off an overpass and is now trying to calm startled motorists]
It's okay. It's okay, folks. It's okay. It's okay. Thank you. Thank you. Danger is my middle name. Don't try this at home, folks. I'm a trained professional. There's me, and there's Super Dave.
[Passes out]

[Joe is convinced Sarah is hiding another man in their bedroom closet]
That door stays shut. What I'm going to do is count to three. Then I'm going to put a bullet in that door.
Jesus.
You can stop me any time by telling the truth.
[Cocks gun]
One...
Call your shrink, Joe! Call him and tell him that you're fucking losing it!
The truth is a beautiful thing.

[Mike is trying to offer Joe a case]
So listen, I'm booked. You got plans?
I'm thinking about smoking some cigarettes.
Could you postpone?
These are pretty good cigarettes.
Hey, motherfucker.
Hey, Milo. Where ya callin' from, the bottom of the pool?
It's called a vocabulary. You got one of those?
Sorry, my subscription to JUGGS magazine ran out.
Come one, Cory, let's go.
Wait, I gotta wait for Hallenbeck.
Are you in some kind of trouble?
It's nothing serious, let's just wait for Hallenbeck.
Is there some guy bothering you?
Seriously, let's just wait for Hallenbeck.
Hallenbeck's a bum. What's he gonna do, light a match and breathe on the guy?
Do you want to get kicked off the planet?
[last lines]
Be prepared, son. That's my motto. Be prepared.
Hey, ugly! Looks like our evidence got blown up. I think we might have to get some more.
Just won't let go, huh? You're like a dog with a frisbee.
[Joe and Jimmy arrive at the stadium and see Marcone's car]
Hey, that's Marcone's car.
Come on!

[pulls out his keys and scratches the car]
I've always wanted to do that.
You should've shit on it.
Push this vile fuck off the road, man!
Excuse me, but did any of you stupid shits bother to frisk this FUCK? He could be a God damned cop. Frisk him please.
I've got bad news and bad news.
Give me the bad news first.
Joe, have you ever heard of the Senate's Commission to Investigate Gambling in Professional Sports?
Is that who you're payin' off?
The commission's gonna vote next March. I got every one of 'em in my hip pocket, except Senator Calvin Baynard. I tried to bribe that son of a bitch, Joe. He gave it back because it wasn't enough.

[chuckles]
What's he want?
Six million. Or he'll go straight to the police. You know, I think it's just gonna be cheaper to kill that son of a bitch.
Takin' off a U.S. Senator, that's pretty ballsy, even for an asshole like you.
You said it, Joe-boy. That's why we're gonna frame you for the senator's murder.
Give him the key or I'll have you kneecapped.
Whoops.
[Jimmy throws a "Shredder" shotgun shell into the fireplace]
Look like nobody gets the money. That's one of those new plastic keys.
Get the god damn key!

[to Joe]
The kind that shred.
Darian, get down!
Hey, last time I saw you drink straight vodka was 'cause you just cheated on Cory.
Yeah, well, why don't you pour me another?
Oh, man. You didn't? You gotta be crazy, partner, cheatin' on her.
I gotta be somethin', Harp. 'Cause nowadays all I do is lose friends, drink, and nail anything with a heartbeat.
Yeah, well, uh, just stay on that side of the bar, huh?

[effeminately]
Oh, Harp.
[first lines]
Billy Cole. Billy Cole.
The first half stunk! Open the holes up! Get in there like hogs! Like pigs!
Billy Cole. You got a call on line three.
Let's go out there in this half and kick some butt! Let's get out of this town as a winner! I hate Cleveland!

[with Jimmy Dix in jacuzzi]
If I were a cat, I'd purrrrrr.
[while Joe is dancing a jig]
You know, for a dancer, he is one hell of a detective.

Football is a dyin' beast, Joe. No heroes left. Not anymore. Since ol' Sonny Werblin paid four hundred thousand dollars to Joe Namath in '66, the son of a bitches have just gotten greedier. God Almighty, when's it enough? Jesus, free agents. "Gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme." Now you got guys on PCP wiggin' out and shootin' themselves on the field. The American public is piss-pot tired of it, and they're changing the channel.
Ratings are down. So you're gonna bribe some senators to legalize gambling.

Legalize sports gambling. You see, with all the heroes gone, legalized gambling is about the only thing that'll save the beast. You follow me, Joe? We're talking about some big bucks here. We're talking about billions. That's nine zeroes, son.
I'm not your fuckin' son.

[in Marcone's office]
Eat shit you fucking redneck!
Since it's the '90s, you don't just smack a guy in the face. You say something cool first.
Like, "I'll be back."
Only better than that. Hit him with a surfboard...
"Surf's up!"
Something like that.
I got bad news and bad news.
Give me the bad news first.
Bad news is someone bounced Jimmy Dix off a car.
Now give me the bad news.
I Just got a statement from Hallenbeck's neighbor. The day he died, Mike Matthews came to Hallenbeck's house early in the morning to discuss a case...

Shit happens real easy, starts out painkillers, Demerol because your fucking knees are shot, before you know it you're chewing Codeine with your pancakes. Then a truck comes out of nowhere then you're talking to the God and say, "hey, help me out big guy, I pay taxes, I go to church, What's with this dead wife and kid shit?" But he isn't answering because he isn't taking any calls that day, then I get a call from the league, and they're saying, "Hey kid, your career is over." I ask "why?" "Because you gamble." Why is there an injury report in pro football? Nobody else has one, only pro football does.
That briefcase was loaded with explosives, wasn't it?

Ten pounds of C-4 is on the way to the Coliseum right now. It's ironic, don't you think? That this bomb's gonna be delivered to Baynard by his own personal bodyguards? After his death, the police will receive a photograph of you, Joseph, handing over the briefcase, and blame you for the crime. And they'll believe it, too, because they know what a fan of Baynard's you are.
Go fuck yourself.
Okay, now that's not polite.
[Opens a switchblade and holds it in Joe's face]
It's very abusive-sounding. What would you do, Joseph, if somebody told you to go fuck yourself? Would you cut one of their eyes out?
No.
No? What would you do?
